heroIntro: This exceptional 4-bedroom villa represents a sophisticated investment opportunity in one of Spain's most discerning coastal communities. Located in the exclusive Campoamor district of Orihuela Costa, this premium residence showcases refined architectural design across 157m² of carefully appointed living space, set on a generous 500m² private plot. Priced at €995,000, this property exemplifies outstanding value within the luxury segment—commanding a premium specification yet positioned 35% below equivalent properties in Costa Blanca's northern regions. The villa caters to discerning buyers seeking both personal sanctuary and investment potential, with the area experiencing consistent year-on-year appreciation of 10% and strong seasonal rental demand averaging €800 per week. Orihuela Costa has established itself as the preferred address for affluent expatriates and international buyers who demand privacy, quality, and proximity to world-class amenities without the overcrowded tourist atmosphere of less exclusive coastal developments.
areaSection: Campoamor is the jewel of Orihuela Costa, a prestigious residential enclave positioned along the Costa Blanca's most coveted stretch. Situated approximately 60 kilometers south of Alicante, this Mediterranean microclimate enjoys over 320 days of annual sunshine and average temperatures of 18°C in winter and 28°C in summer. The area is defined by its mature landscaping, low-density development philosophy, and strong architectural standards that preserve the region's upscale character. Campoamor benefits from proximity to pristine beaches including La Zenia (Blue Flag certified), Cabo Roig, and the discrete Playa Flamenca—each offering distinct personalities from family-friendly to more exclusive settings. The surrounding countryside features rolling terrain with distant sea views, golf courses integrated seamlessly into the landscape, and Mediterranean pine forests that provide natural privacy and cooling. Unlike the overdeveloped north, Campoamor maintains strict building regulations and limited commercial density, preserving genuine tranquility.
lifestyleSection: Living in Campoamor means access to an international community of accomplished professionals, entrepreneurs, and retirees who have deliberately chosen this destination. The strong expatriate population—particularly from Britain, Scandinavia, and the Netherlands—has created an ecosystem where English is widely spoken and international standards are maintained across healthcare, education, and services. Daily life centers on exceptional infrastructure: world-class golf courses like Villamartín sit virtually on the doorstep, offering championship-level play; La Zenia Boulevard provides comprehensive shopping with international brands and fine dining; and the Spanish lifestyle remains authentically present through weekly markets, local tapas bars, and established community events. Healthcare is exceptionally well-served with English-speaking medical professionals and modern facilities minutes away. The area cultivates a refined but unpretentious atmosphere—this is where successful individuals live, not where tourists visit. The beach lifestyle is accessible yet never intrusive, allowing residents to maintain dignity and privacy while enjoying Mediterranean outdoor living.
investmentSection: This property represents a strategically positioned investment within a market demonstrating measurable appreciation. Orihuela Costa has experienced consistent 10% year-on-year price growth, outperforming broader Spanish real estate markets and maintaining resilience through economic cycles. The villa's premium specification at €6,338/m² positions it advantageously below comparable properties in Costa Blanca's northern regions (typically €9,700/m² or higher), while exceeding the local average of €2,100/m² due to superior construction standards and location within Campoamor's exclusive sector. Rental income represents a secondary revenue stream: comparable properties generate €800+ weekly during peak season (June-September), with extended shoulder seasons (April-May, October-November) providing 60-70% occupancy at competitive rates. The four-bedroom configuration appeals to family groups and corporate retreats, commanding premium nightly rates. Long-term ownership appreciation, coupled with seasonal rental generation and the lifestyle benefits of Mediterranean residence, creates a comprehensive investment thesis beyond traditional real estate speculation.
conclusion: This villa represents a refined opportunity for discerning buyers seeking authentic Mediterranean residence combined with intelligent investment positioning. The €995,000 price point, premium construction standards, and location within prestigious Campoamor provide compelling value within the luxury market segment. Orihuela Costa's established international community, exceptional infrastructure, and consistent appreciation trajectory appeal to those prioritizing lifestyle quality and financial prudence equally. Whether as a personal sanctuary for year-round residence, seasonal base for family holidays, or part-time income-generating property, this villa delivers sophistication without compromise. The genuine scarcity of comparable opportunities at this price point suggests limited availability. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Campoamor provides comprehensive infrastructure supporting cosmopolitan living standards. Residents access world-class healthcare, international education, sophisticated shopping, and efficient transportation—all while maintaining the tranquility and privacy of a low-density residential community.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Orihuela Costa meets international standards with English-speaking medical professionals and modern facilities. Hospital de Torrevieja, located 15 minutes away, provides full acute care services, emergency departments, and specialist facilities. Quirónsalud (20 minutes) represents another major private healthcare provider with comprehensive diagnostic and surgical capabilities. Local medical centers throughout Campoamor employ English-speaking general practitioners and nursing staff, enabling routine consultations without language barriers. Prescription medications are readily available and competitively priced. Many residents maintain private health insurance through international providers (Sanitas, Axa, or equivalent Spanish schemes) providing supplementary coverage and access to private specialists. Dental and optical care meet international standards with practitioners accustomed to expatriate clientele.

education.text: For families with children, international education options provide continuity with British and international curricula. El Limonar International School (15 minutes) offers programs from primary through upper secondary, emphasizing academic excellence and expatriate community integration. Kings College Murcia (40 minutes) provides an alternative British curriculum option with strong university preparation. Spanish state schools (educación pública) are available for families preferring Spanish language immersion and are significantly less expensive, though less commonly chosen by expatriate families. The area's mature expatriate community has established extensive networks around school selection and childcare solutions.

shopping.text: Shopping in Campoamor combines Mediterranean markets with modern retail convenience. La Zenia Boulevard, 4 kilometers away, functions as a comprehensive shopping destination featuring Carrefour hypermarket, international fashion brands, electronics retailers, and fine dining restaurants. Daily provisions are available at Mercadona and Consum supermarkets throughout the area, with Lidl providing budget-conscious alternatives. Weekly farmers' markets in Torrevieja and surrounding towns offer fresh Mediterranean produce, fish, and local products. The shopping experience accommodates both international preferences (familiar brand products) and authentic Spanish regional specialties.
keyPoints: La Zenia Boulevard: 4km, comprehensive shopping with international brands and restaurants
Mercadona and Consum: Multiple locations within Campoamor for daily provisioning
Weekly farmers' markets: Fresh Mediterranean produce and local specialties in nearby towns

transport.text: Orihuela Costa prioritizes personal vehicle ownership over public transportation reliance. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's third-busiest international airport, lies 55 kilometers north (approximately 50 minutes' drive), providing direct connections to Northern Europe, the UK, and international destinations. Regional buses operate between Campoamor and larger towns, though frequency is limited and suited to occasional rather than daily commuting. The area is well-positioned for independent exploration: Murcia city (university cultural center) is 80 kilometers; the medieval town of Lorca is 70 kilometers; Granada and the Sierra Nevada are accessible as weekend excursions. Road infrastructure is modern with well-maintained highways and clear signage.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa a good place to live?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Orihuela Costa ranks among Spain's most desirable coastal residences, particularly for international buyers valuing privacy and infrastructure over tourist accessibility. The area combines authentic Mediterranean lifestyle with modern amenities, comprehensive healthcare in English, excellent schools for families, and a mature expatriate community of accomplished professionals. The consistent 10% year-on-year appreciation confirms market confidence.

faqs.question: What is Orihuela Costa known for?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is renowned for its exclusive residential character, world-class golf courses (Villamartín, Campoamor, Las Colinas), pristine Mediterranean beaches, and strong international community. The region attracts discerning residents seeking sophisticated coastal living without the overdevelopment or tourist saturation of northern Costa Blanca. Blue Flag beaches, championship golf, and low-density development define its reputation.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa safe?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orihuela Costa maintains excellent safety standards with low crime rates compared to urban centers. The area benefits from community awareness, private security in residential developments, and Spanish police presence. The established expatriate community and family-oriented character reinforce the secure atmosphere. Healthcare and emergency services are reliably responsive.

faqs.question: How far is Orihuela Costa from Alicante?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is located approximately 60 kilometers south of Alicante city center, requiring 50-60 minutes by car via the AP-7 motorway. Alicante-Elche Airport is 55 kilometers away (approximately 50-minute drive), providing convenient international connections. The distance provides isolation from urban traffic and noise while maintaining accessibility for airport transfers and city excursions.

faqs.question: Can non-Spanish citizens purchase property in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-Spanish EU citizens and non-EU nationals can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. International buyers typically require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which is readily obtained. Most transactions involve English-speaking Spanish lawyers and property agents experienced in international sales. Financing is available through Spanish banks for qualifying borrowers with competitive rates.

faqs.question: What are the ongoing costs for villa ownership in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Annual costs include property tax (IBI, approximately 0.4-0.8% of registered value), community fees if applicable (typically €50-150 monthly in developments), municipal waste fees, and optional utilities and maintenance. Property tax on a €995,000 property approximates €4,000-8,000 annually depending on municipal assessment. International property owners benefit from tax-efficient structures available under non-habitual resident regulations.
